algorithms.imageProcessing.segmentation

Class SLICSuperPixelsGS

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.segmentation.SLICSuperPixelsGS

  • public class SLICSuperPixelsGS
extends java.lang.Object
    a variant of kmeans whose goal is to make k super-pixels in the image based upon greyscale similarity and x,y proximity. The code implements the algorithm of: "SLIC Superpixels Compared to State-of-the-Art Superpixel Methods" by Achanta, Appu Shaji,Smith, Lucchi, Fua, and Su Ìˆsstrunk, but replaces the cielab colorspace with greyscale color space.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Constructor Detail

      • SLICSuperPixelsGS

        public SLICSuperPixelsGS(GreyscaleImage img,
                         int nClusters,
                         double clrNorm)
        constructor for the super-pixel algorithm SLIC that uses the color space of greyscale and creates approximately nClusters (a.k.a. super-pixels). The number of clusters may be adjusted for even intervals over width and height.
        Parameters:
        img -
        nClusters -
        clrNorm - a smaller number than 10 finds details such as textures and a number closer to 40 produces very blocky segmentation mostly lacking curves. (NOTE: these numbers need to be updated for GS, but the directions of change are same).

      • SLICSuperPixelsGS

        public SLICSuperPixelsGS(GreyscaleImage img,
                         int nClusters)
        constructor for the super-pixel algorithm SLIC that uses the default color space of greyscale and creates approximately nClusters (a.k.a. super-pixels). The number of clusters may be adjusted for even intervals over width and height. Uses a default clrNorm = 10;
        Parameters:
        img -
        nClusters -
